verses.text: The proverbs of Solomon. A wise son maketh a glad father: But a foolish son \add is\add* the heaviness of his mother.
Treasures of wickedness profit nothing: But righteousness delivereth from death.
The \sc Lord\sc* will not suffer the soul of the righteous to famish: But he casteth away the substance of the wicked.
\add He becometh\add* poor that dealeth \add with\add* a slack hand: But the hand of the diligent maketh rich.
He that gathereth in summer \add is\add* a wise son: \add But\add* he that sleepeth in harvest \add is\add* a son that causeth shame.
Blessings \add are\add* upon the head of the just: But violence covereth the mouth of the wicked.
The memory of the just \add is\add* blessed: But the name of the wicked shall rot.
The wise in heart will receive commandments: But a prating fool shall fall.
He that walketh uprightly walketh surely: But he that perverteth his ways shall be known.
He that winketh \add with\add* the eye causeth sorrow: But a prating fool shall fall.
The mouth of a righteous \add man is\add* a well of life: But violence covereth the mouth of the wicked.
Hatred stirreth up strifes: But love covereth all sins.
In the lips of him that hath understanding wisdom is found: But a rod \add is\add* for the back of him that is void of understanding.
Wise \add men\add* lay up knowledge: But the mouth of the foolish \add is\add* near destruction.
The rich \add manâ€™s\add* wealth \add is\add* his strong city: The destruction of the poor \add is\add* their poverty.
The labour of the righteous \add tendeth\add* to life: The fruit of the wicked to sin.
He \add is in\add* the way of life that keepeth instruction: But he that refuseth reproof erreth.
He that hideth hatred \add with\add* lying lips, And he that uttereth a slander, \add is\add* a fool.
In the multitude of words there wanteth not sin: But he that refraineth his lips \add is\add* wise.
The tongue of the just \add is as\add* choice silver: The heart of the wicked \add is\add* little worth.
The lips of the righteous feed many: But fools die for want of wisdom.
The blessing of the \sc Lord\sc*, it maketh rich, And he addeth no sorrow with it.
\add It is\add* as sport to a fool to do mischief: But a man of understanding hath wisdom.
The fear of the wicked, it shall come \add upon\add* him: But the desire of the righteous shall be granted.
As the whirlwind passeth, so \add is\add* the wicked no \add more:\add* But the righteous \add is\add* an everlasting foundation.
As vinegar to the teeth, and as smoke to the eyes, So \add is\add* the sluggard to them that send him.
The fear of the \sc Lord\sc* prolongeth days: But the years of the wicked shall be shortened.
The hope of the righteous \add shall be\add* gladness: But the expectation of the wicked shall perish.
The way of the \sc Lord\sc* \add is\add* strength to the upright: But destruction \add shall be\add* to the workers of iniquity.
The righteous shall never be removed: But the wicked shall not inhabit the earth.
The mouth of the just bringeth forth wisdom: But the froward tongue shall be cut out.
The lips of the righteous know what is acceptable: But the mouth of the wicked \add speaketh\add* frowardness.
